basics.name: Michael Engen
basics.label: Full-stack Engineer
basics.summary:
I am a software developer with a background in full-stack development, technical writing, and scientific programming.

 Passionate about helping others and technology, I've built end-to-end testing tools, written technical content, and worked directly with developers to identify product improvements. I care deeply about communication and have extensive experience, including six years spent teaching at the undergraduate level, five published novel mathematical research papers, and 18 talks on mathematical research.

My personal development projects include PermPy, an open-source Python library for working with combinatorial patterns.

work.name: PayPal
highlights: Collaborated with external developers to identify potential product and documentation improvements
Designed and developed an internal end-to-end testing tool using Python and JavaScript, simplifying and enhancing testing of PayPal APIs and SDKs
Wrote extensive developer-facing documentation to streamline and support integration processes

work.name: Bridgerock Data
highlights: Engaged with external stakeholders to uncover their business-intelligence needs and created custom SQL-powered reports for analyzing key performance indicators
Implemented a new database and computing infrastructure for ETL processes using AWS EC2, ECS, and CloudFormation
Collaborated both remotely and in-person using an agile software development process and gained experience in a fast-paced startup work environment

work.name: University of Florida
highlights: Co-developed Xronos, an open-source online learning platform that empowers mathematics educators to create online homework assignments using LaTeX
Met directly with users to collect product feedback

work.name: Oak Ridge National Laboratory
highlights: Developed and implemented a frequent subgraph mining algorithm for extracting features from plaintext cancer pathology reports in Python
Utilized feature selection to improve classification rate of the automatic pathology reporting

work.name: University of Florida
highlights: Developed curriculum and instructed students, both in group settings and one-on-one
Quantified students' performance through proctored assessments both in-person and remotely

projects.name: PermPy
projects.description: PermPy is an open-source Python library for generating and analyzing large combinatorial datasets.
highlightsOld: Co-authored an open-source Python library for generating and analyzing large combinatorial datasets
Utilized PermPy to perform computations for numerous published and in-preparation mathematical research articles
Empowered young researchers with accessible software tools to use in their own computational research
highlights: Implemented unit tests, CI/CD, and programmatically generated documentation
Empowered young researchers with accessible software tools to use in their own computational research
